Heading: Number of victims
Value:
Convicted of killing 1(believed to have killed dozens), 
confessed to 2 murders, raped 85 women, responsible for 185 robberies

Heading: Raised by
Value: Uncle Gene and Aunt Mildred Wood after mother died in 1955; due to James’ problems the Wood relatives relinquished their custody and James became a ward of the state.

Heading: Family event
Value: Father incarcerated at a federal prison when James was 2 years old; at this time James and his mother moved to Pocatello, ID where his mother remarried. His mother died in a fire while working in a potato factory when James was 8 years old. James was in school right across the street and watched the fire.

Heading: Physically attractive?
Value: A 160-180lb Caucasian male with short brown hair---fit in and was not noticeable physically by others around him.

Heading: Physical defect?
Value: 1990 – Severely injured 3 fingers on his left hand while using a power saw – had surgery, but still had problems using his hand.

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: James claimed he was physically abused by his step-father.

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: James claimed he was psychologically abused by his step-father.

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value: James claimed he was sexually abused by his step-father.

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: Business selling and installing chain fences

Heading: Highest grade in school
Value: Most of teenage years he was in a youth correction center and attended a reform school in Idaho until 17.

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Fired from jobs?
Value: James had trouble holding down jobs where he was fired or he just quit and would not return to that place of employment to work.

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value:
Installed chain fences, carnival truck driver, painted old saws and metal milk jugs with wild life scenes for money & 
dishwasher, but he usually stole money to survive. Wood did not like to work because it was “too boring”.

Heading: Sexual preference
Value: Heterosexual - homosexual tendencies began in prison

Heading: Diagnosis
Value: Impulsive, anti-social, no conscience, lack of remorse, sexual sadism, violent outbursts, sensitive to criticism, unpredictable, loner

Heading: Spend time in prison?
Value: Served 4.5 years in Angola State Penitentiary (1967-1971). Served a second sentence of 6 years out of 10 for robbery and rape. He was released for good behavior.

Heading: Number of victims
Value: Not certain- Convicted of 1 killing and suspected of multiple others

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Date of first kill in series
Date of final kill in series
Method of killing
Value: Shot in head; Jeralee Underwood was dismembered.

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Lived within a few neighborhoods of the victims

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Victim abducted or killed at contact?
Stalked victims?
Value: Jeralee- He knew her newspaper route

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Killer executed?
Value: No, but was on death row (died of natural causes)

Heading: Killer killed in prison?
Value: No, died from a heart attack
